channel.title: Please help me with no-ip
channel.description: so i download pvpscapez source and client and portforwarded and did everything and my port works i checked it on canyouseeme.org and it said it can see the port but when i put no-ip in my loader.java the client doesn't work but when i put 127.0.01 it works can anyone help me if you can i will give you rep+

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

[quote=“Project Amazed Carlos, post:13, topic:510874”]Their bunch of idiots who listen to people that listen to other people that listen to other people.
I have 20 players online daily and my ip is set on 127.0.01 people try to ddos me but they fail because my cmd catches it and sends me and if i don’t see it they get banned via cmd or they can’t ddos a 127.0.0.1[/quote]
Loooooooooooooool

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Project_Amazed_Carlo Project Amazed Carlos
item.description:
@Project_Amazed_Carlo wrote:

I HAVE NO IDEAL, your computer or your server problem idk, but i got to go.

I recommend you jar it then check if the download jar client works if it doesn’t you jarred wrong or the server sucks.

Peace i hope i helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @ranqedrs ranqedrs
item.description:
@ranqedrs wrote:

Project Amazed Carlos:

Yeah, because it is a autocachedownloader thing, so it is right but your source has to have some cache in the source, because mine does and if i don’t turn source on my client or web-client won’t load because it can’t read the source cache if it is on… So if your source doesn’t have it i recommened throwing that garbage away. Mine is a Project Insanity or Runescape base. So i don’t know if mine is the same as yours.

first my client was not working then i puted 127.0.0.1 and then it worked now its not working

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Project_Amazed_Carlo Project Amazed Carlos
item.description:
@Project_Amazed_Carlo wrote:

Yeah, because it is a autocachedownloader thing, so it is right but your source has to have some cache in the source, because mine does and if i don’t turn source on my client or web-client won’t load because it can’t read the source cache if it is on… So if your source doesn’t have it i recommened throwing that garbage away. Mine is a Project Insanity or Runescape base. So i don’t know if mine is the same as yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @ranqedrs ranqedrs
item.description:
@ranqedrs wrote:

Arcik:

is your cache in /data/cache?

my cache is in my windows where my name is when you click the bottom on the left and it alaways was there and it worked

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Project_Amazed_Carlo Project Amazed Carlos
item.description:
@Project_Amazed_Carlo wrote:

I don’t know i don’t leech other servers, i actually use cleaned bases. I never used any but Project Insanity. Not saying you leech.

Hopefully it does because mine is set to 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @ranqedrs ranqedrs
item.description:
@ranqedrs wrote:

Project Amazed Carlos:

I strongly recommend jarring it, because lots of 667, 718 don’t work and you need to jar it for it to actually work.

if i jar it will it work? and i got 127.0.0.1 ip in loader.java so i cnt let other people join my server people are saying and the client run worked a while ago

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Project_Amazed_Carlo Project Amazed Carlos
item.description:
@Project_Amazed_Carlo wrote:

I strongly recommend jarring it, because lots of 667, 718 don’t work and you need to jar it for it to actually work.

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @ranqedrs ranqedrs
item.description:
@ranqedrs wrote:

[quote=“Project Amazed Carlos, post:8, topic:510874”]Make sure the source has noo errors and that it has no anti leech
and that you run source 20 seconds before you run client

also give us more description of: your source + cache + client
did you download separately? or you probably jarred wrong.

You have to jar the bin and Loader.java nor loader.java but Loader.java on the bin file.[/quote]

im talking about when you first download a server you need to run from a client file not a jar so when i try to run it it doesn’t work it runed a little while ago

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Project_Amazed_Carlo Project Amazed Carlos
item.description:
@Project_Amazed_Carlo wrote:

Make sure the source has noo errors and that it has no anti leech
and that you run source 20 seconds before you run client

also give us more description of: your source + cache + client
did you download separately? or you probably jarred wrong.

You have to jar the bin and Loader.java nor loader.java but Loader.java on the bin file.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @ranqedrs ranqedrs
item.description:
@ranqedrs wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:4, topic:510874”][quote author=Project Amazed Carlos link=topic=629119.msg4269715#msg4269715 date=1364427924]
Doesn’t really matter if it is 127.0.0.1 it will connect to your internet, mine is 127.0.0.1 and it works fine as people login and when i shut down my server i can’t login, so if people say you need it as your ip their wrong, though t is better to have your source ip to your ip. Plus client ip doesn’t really need to be your ip either. My cousin said it shouldn’t really damage you.

Hope this helps.
[/quote]
what are you talking about…

you connect on localhost (127.0.0.1) and your players connect on your no-ip or whatever.[/quote]

im having another problem a while ago my client 'run" worked but now its stuck 1% and the custom build and sub build are same number and i did run my source before runing the client please help me

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Project Amazed Carlos, post:5, topic:510874”]What are you talking about?

My client is on 127.0.0.1 and 20 people connect daily so don’t say what am i talking about because i do know what iam, your source grabs from the rinter byte and it reads it and transmits it to your computer wireless.[/quote]

I thinking your confusing NPC’s with players.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me with no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Project Amazed Carlos, post:2, topic:510874”]Doesn’t really matter if it is 127.0.0.1 it will connect to your internet, mine is 127.0.0.1 and it works fine as people login and when i shut down my server i can’t login, so if people say you need it as your ip their wrong, though t is better to have your source ip to your ip. Plus client ip doesn’t really need to be your ip either. My cousin said it shouldn’t really damage you.

Hope this helps.[/quote]
what are you talking about…

you connect on localhost (127.0.0.1) and your players connect on your no-ip or whatever.

Read full topic
